title: _Operating Room RN/Circulator (Ambulatory Surgery Center), Melville, NY
description:
We are looking for a full-time **Operating Room RN** for a multi-specialty surgery center located in Melville, NY

This is a permanent, full-time job, 7.5-hour shifts (6:15am, 6:30am or 6:45am start time), 5 days a week Monday through Friday. No weekends or holidays.

Join our team as a Registered Nurse - Operating Room where you will play a crucial role in providing high-quality patient care in our surgical unit. As a key member of our healthcare team, you will be responsible for assisting in surgical procedures, ensuring patient safety, and maintaining a sterile environment in the operating room.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Nursing
* Valid NYS RN License
* BLS/ACLS/PALS certification; can acquire after hire ASAP if do not have currently.
* Experience in an operating room for at least 1 (one) year

Responsibilities:  
- Perform pre-operative assessments and post-operative evaluations on patients undergoing surgical procedures.  
- Assist surgeons during operations by providing necessary instruments and supplies.  
- Monitor patients' vital signs and assist in managing anesthesia administration.  
- Maintain a sterile field in the operating room to prevent infections and ensure patient safety.  
- Collaborate with the healthcare team to develop individualized care plans for patients.  
- Document all aspects of patient care accurately and timely.  
- Adhere to all hospital policies, procedures, and regulatory guidelines.  
- Participate in continuous education and training to stay current with best practices in perioperative nursing.

This full-time position offers competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits package, opportunities for professional growth, and a supportive work environment. If you are a dedicated Registered Nurse with a passion for perioperative nursing, we encourage you to apply.

description:

* Supervises the department to insure that the daily activities and functions of the department are carried out in an efficient manner.
* Works closely with the Medicaid Coordinator to insure that all required documentation is gathered and reviewed for prospective applicants so that financial issues are satisfied at the time of admission.

* Respects the patient’s right to confidentiality at all times.

* Demonstrates judgment and tact when dealing with patients, visitors, and co-workers.
* Uses professional judgment and flexibility in presenting alternatives or innovative solutions to problems encountered.
* Cooperates with other Departments or work groups/peers.
* Demonstrates appearance and hygiene appropriate to the delivery of quality services. Maintains professional appearance, adhering to the state uniform policy including identification badge.
* Complies with fire, disaster, infection control, safety hazard, and emergency procedures.
* Reports to work on time and is ready to work at start of shift; adheres to department schedules.
* Give appropriate notice of absenteeism and does not abuse time off benefit.
* Other duties as assigned.

title: Assistant Director of Nursing
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU

School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000

employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits

and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have

served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a

Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric

emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and

neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a citywide

medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and

Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit

(ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every

employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion,

Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

Purpose of Position:

Under the guidance and direction of the Director of Nursing, the A.D.N is responsible for planning, organizing,

directing, coordinating and evaluating the quality of care rendered in the E.D. The A.D.N has the authority and

responsibility of managing the unit in order to guarantee the quality of care for every patient assigned to the

unit and is held accountable by the use of the nursing process. She/he is responsible for the implementation of

the Nursing Department's philosophy and objective of nursing care into management of nursing care on the

patient's unit.

Job Responsibilities:

- Receives report by making walking rounds with incoming/outgoing staff.

- Coordinates patient care by collaborating with the multidisciplinary team.

- Assess each patient needs and establishes appropriate plan of care based on Nursing Assessment and

diagnosis.

- Maintains standards of care by ensuring that an individualized plan of care for each patient is developed and

implemented.

- Evaluates nursing care, the patient's response to intervention and make modifications as needed.

- Delegates assignments based on staff competence and priority of patient care utilizing the departmental

triage classification system.

- Supervises and assists the staff in patient assessments, documentation, implementation and evaluation of

nursing care.

- Supervision of professional and non-professional personnel.

- Completes performance evaluation for assigned staff.

- Maintains attendance profiles on personnel, which will be reviewed periodically.

- Other tasks as assigned by Supervisor or designee.

Minimum Qualifications

1. Licensed and currently registered to practice as a professional nurse in New York State, plus (2) or (3),

below.

2. Masters Degree in Nursing Administration, Education, Clinical Specialty or equivalent field and five years of

satisfactory nursing experience, of which three years shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity; or

a Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing and six years of satisfactory nursing experience, four years of which shall

have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity.

3. A satisfactory equivalent of education and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and

currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State.```Job Overview:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Director of Nursing to join our team. As the Director of Nursing, you will be responsible for overseeing the nursing department and ensuring the delivery of high-quality patient care. This is a leadership role that requires strong managerial and clinical skills.

Duties:  
- Manage and supervise the nursing staff, including hiring, training, and evaluating performance  
- Develop and implement policies and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory standards  
- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to coordinate patient care  
- Create and maintain care plans for patients  
- Monitor and evaluate patient outcomes and make necessary adjustments to the care plan  
- Ensure adherence to resident rights and promote a safe and comfortable environment for patients  
- Utilize medical terminology and anatomy knowledge to effectively communicate with healthcare providers  
- Oversee nursing administration tasks, such as scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation  
- Provide leadership and guidance to nursing staff, promoting professional development

Requirements:  
- Valid nursing license in [state]  
- Proven experience in nursing administration or a similar leadership role  
- Strong knowledge of healthcare systems and regulations  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  
- Ability to manage multiple priorities and work well under pressure  
- Experience in home health or long-term care settings is preferred  
- Demonstrated ability to develop care plans based on individual patient needs  
- Leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire a team

If you are a dedicated nurse leader looking for an opportunity to make a difference in patient care, we encourage you to apply for the position of Director of Nursing. We offer competitive compensation packages and opportunities for professional growth. Apply today!```

title: HR Benefits Assistant
company: Mary Pomerantz Advertising for Catholic Charities of Brooklyn & Queens
description:
For over 125 years, Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens has been providing quality social services to the neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens and currently offers 160-plus programs and services for children, youth, adults, seniors, and those struggling with mental illness.

STATEMENT OF THE JOB:

Under the direction of the Benefits Manager, the HR Benefits Assistant provides clerical assistance for the Benefits Team. Works with the team in coordinating, implementing and maintaining human resources systems and ensuring productivity and efficiency throughout the organization. Demonstrates continuous effort to improve operations, decrease turnaround times, streamline work processes and provide a high level of customer service.

· Provide general clerical support for the Benefits Team with administering benefit programs such as medical, dental, vision, flexible spending accounts, commuter benefits, life insurance, voluntary benefits, grandfathered pension plan and the 403(b) Tax Deferred Retirement Annuity plan.

· Provide phone coverage support to benefits hotline and check benefits email and forward to appropriate Team member

· Prepare benefit attachments/link and send out invitations to monthly new hire benefit orientation meetings which includes:

· compiling required attendance roster through Dayforce (HRIS) reports

· assisting employees with enrollment and/or waiver forms

· follow- up with employee’s not attending orientation

· ensuring receipt of enrollment and waiver documentation are received.

· Create employee benefit physical files and maintain employee benefits filing system on the shared drive. Pull termed benefits folders and place in personnel folders.

· Keep track of Worker’s Compensation and Disability Certificates for all locations.

· Screen and sort incoming mail and forward to appropriate Team member. File as appropriate.

· Perform other administrative duties as assigned or requested

· Work on benefit related activities/projects as directed.

title: '25 Summer Associate (MBA) – Real Estate Investments
description:
**SUMMARY**



The Investments internship offers a comprehensive immersion into our pivotal responsibilities, encompassing underwriting, asset management, management services, and development. This unique opportunity empowers interns to synergize their adept analytical prowess with effective communication across our platform of services. Our ability to create, strengthen and manage external and internal relationships is the cornerstone of our success. It's our relationship-based strategy that distinguishes us as trailblazers and leaders in our industry.


**WHY WELLTOWER FOR THE SUMMER**



Welltower offers accomplished students the opportunity to partake in a variety of immersive summer internship programs. Each program is meticulously crafted to center around a foundational skill set and essential business processes. This strategic design enables participants to concentrate on their foremost passion and optimize their inherent talents. Spanning over the course of ten enriching weeks, our programs grant students the privilege to engage directly with our esteemed senior management team, take charge of impactful projects, and undergo a transformative journey of personal and professional expansion. All of this transpires within a culture that lauds ambition and tenacity, fostering an environment where aspirations thrive.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**



The Investments team is responsible for:


* Analyzing investment opportunities from initial valuation through closing
* The creation and management of our seniors housing and medical facilities relationships
* Working with our partners to ensure strong financial performance and operations of our joint assets
* Underwriting acquisition and development opportunities
* Operator/client credit analysis; business plan review and analysis
* Analyzing operator performance
* Conducting site visits and market assessments
* Conducting variance analyses; performing liquidity analyses
* Evaluating management teams and properties
* Evaluating property risk
* Analyzing operator performance
* Building financial models
* Creating budgets and forecasts
* Monitoring leasing activity
* Updating ARGUS models
* Understanding market supply and demand fundamentals
* Managing relationships with our operators and partners


**OTHER DUTIES**



Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of this employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


**TRAVEL**



Some out-of-area and overnight travel may be expected.


**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**



Education: Must be currently enrolled in a MBA program.



Experience: Previous internship and/or work experience preferred.


*Applicants must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen.*


**COMPENSATION** - the salary range for this role in NYC is $8,600 - $10,400/month


**ABOUT WELLTOWER**

Welltower, an S&P 500 company headquartered in Toledo, Ohio, is driving the transformation of health care infrastructure. The Company invests with leading seniors housing operators, post-acute providers and health systems to fund the real estate and infrastructure needed to scale innovative care delivery models and improve people's wellness and overall health care experience. Welltower, a real estate investment trust ("REIT"), owns interests in properties concentrated in major, high-growth markets in the United States, Canada and the United Kingdom, consisting of seniors housing, post-acute communities and outpatient medical properties. More information is available at www.welltower.com


*Welltower is committed to leveraging the talent of a diverse workforce to create great opportunities for our business and our people. EOE/AA. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Vet*


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Clinical Sales Specialist, Community Specialties - Manhattan South, NYC
description:
Developing innovative therapies is one of the most challenging, most essential, and personally rewarding fields in science. This is the most exciting time to be a part of Astellas, a company with a uniquely collaborative and patient-focused culture.


There's something special about working at Astellas. It's reflected in our focus on the people we serve, the way we treat each other and the results we achieve together as a company.


Astellas is announcing a Clinical Sales Professional - Community Specialties opportunity in the **Manhattan South, NYC** area.


**The Role**


Achieve territory sales goals by promoting Astellas products and services to physicians and other medical personnel within assigned geography. Educate customers on the use, characteristics, advantages, indicated treatments and all other developments related to promoted products. Professionally represent Astellas in the field and ensure high levels of visibility and customer satisfaction in territory. Maintain effective communication and relationships with key external and internal customers.


Flexible grade level based on candidate background and skillset


**Primary Responsibilities**


Effectively promote and educate targeted physicians/HCPs on the use of Astellas' products through one-on-one meetings and group presentations, company-approved promotional speaker programs, and other company-approved means.



Work 5 days in the field each week, supported by office time as needed for call planning, customer follow-up, preparing presentations, making appointments, report generation, etc.



Ensure solid performance levels of call and field productivity. Meet Call Plan expectations and achieve territory product sales goals while adhering to all APUS-defined ethical sales practices, Compliance guidelines, and required promotional regulations



Execute company-approved Product Marketing plans and territory/regional business plan activities



Support targeted customers using company-approved resources, sales materials, and promotional activities/programs/initiatives as identified by Sales Management



Coordinate promotional efforts with peers across franchises and co-promotion alliance partners as appropriate. This includes appropriately managing/maintaining all company equipment and company-approved promotional materials (e.g., sales materials, company literature, product samples, etc.) according to defined company Compliance guidelines



Achieve territory product sales goals while adhering to all APUS-defined ethical sales practices, Compliance guidelines, and required promotional regulations



Ensure territory sales strategy execution using annual territory business plan, regional business plan, and call activity reports



Accurately report/submit sales call activities, territory expenses and written reports and within deadline as defined by Astellas or the Regional Sales Manager



Attend all company-sponsored sales and medical meetings as directed by company management.



Additional duties as needed



**Quantitative Dimensions**


This position is responsible for achieving both territory product sales goals and territory sales activity goals through company defined metrics

**Organizational Context**


It is important for individuals in this position to actively pursue continuous learning and professional sales development on effective sales and communication techniques and product/therapeutic area knowledge.


This position:


Is a customer facing sales position



Reports to Regional Sales manager



Maintains territory responsible for managing Astellas' products



Partners with counterparts, teammates, and cross functional colleagues as appropriate



Balance’s territory and regional work and projects, while maintaining solid level of sales performance



Exhibits strong level of skill in competencies



Demonstrates sales influence within territory and at times within region



**Qualifications**


**Required**


BA/BS degree



2+ years pharmaceutical selling experience



Strong knowledge of sales processes and pharmaceutical products and industry



Solid communication, facilitation, and presentation skills



Proactive; can do approach



Demonstrates problem solving ability; analytical; business acumen



Solid motivational and persuasion skills



Demonstrates team orientation and leadership



Proven record of sustained high sales performance and achievement



Proficient in MS Office Suite



Ability to travel at least up to 50% of the time; and at times overnight travel



Valid driver’s license in good standing



**Preferred**


Advanced degree or continued education



Knowledge of promoting specialty products



**Benefits:**


Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance



Generous Paid Time Off options, including Vacation, Sick time, plus national holidays including Heritage Days, and Summer and Winter Breaks



401(k) match and annual company contribution



Company paid life insurance



Annual Corporate Bonus and Quarterly Sales Incentive for eligible positions



Long Term Incentive Plan for eligible positions



Referral bonus program



Compensation: $81,800 – 109,000 (NOTE: Final salary could be more or less, commensurate with experience)


This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work which may be performed by the person assigned to this position. This job description is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of this position.


Employees holding this position may perform other job-related duties in the course of their performance of this position


**#LI-LK**


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.


Category Sales


Astellas is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment.


EOE including Disability/Protected Veterans

title: Hybrid BCBA Opportunity for Per Diem Position in Brooklyn, NY
description:
**Position Title:** Per Diem BCBA

**Setting & Location**: Variable

**Position Type:** Per Diem

**Pay:** Commensurate with skill level and experience.

**Job Responsibilities w/ case info:**

**Age/Gender: 4 year old male.**

**Location, Brooklyn, NY in person, 11238**

**Family Schedule:**  In Person, Monday-Friday, 2:30p-5:30p

· Obtain and maintain 1+ case(s) & meet all approved hours of the authorization,

· Reach out to the family of every new case received within 3 business days.

· Interviewstaff and/or family members who know the patient before the development of the treatment plan to get the necessary background and preliminary information.

· Conduct initial assessments and periodic 3- or 6-month re-assessments promptly, submittingthem by the due date assigned. Ensure the completed treatment plan addresses the function of the problem behaviors.

· Define all target behaviors in objective and measurable terms and add them to the treatment plan to measure the target behaviors.

· Integrate the proper setting event, antecedent, teaching, and consequence strategies to reduce the patient’s problem behavior and increase alternative replacement behaviors.

· Directly see the patient in all relevant settings. Analyze the data to determinethe function of the problem behavior. Describe where, when, and why the problem behaviors occur while supplying descriptive monthly progress notes.

· Train staff and family members directly, allowing enough time for questions and discussion about the implementation of the treatment plan.

· Assume responsibility for parent training, ABA (Applied Behavioral Analysis) therapist supervision, and treatment planning/BTM services for each case.

· Record all session notes in the Provider Portal and finalize monthly notes on or before given deadlines.

· Review your patients’ behavior data and note any discrepancies (e.g., lack of documentation, inappropriate restrictions, or lack of proper consequences) and situations in which the current behavior program or treatment approach were not followed appropriately. Check each report to ensure that the time, date, signatures, are correct).

· If the intervention has not produced substantial progress toward the intended goal within 90 days (about 3 months), analyze the potential barriers to implementation and/or change the treatment plan if necessary.

· Perform administrative tasks as needed within one business day. (Form completion, signing insurance documents, etc.)

**Minimum Training and Experience:**

Individuals who provide ABA services through behavior analytic services shall be licensed behavior analysts with a scope of practice that includes overseeing the provision of ABA services and have a BCBAcertification (Board Certified Behavioral Analyst) through the BACB (Behavior Analyst Certification Board).

Individuals will also have at least 6 months of experience in rendering ABA services and a master's degree in psychology, social work, counseling, education, or related field.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $90.00 - $110.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Referral program

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Education:

* Master's (Required)

License/Certification:

* Board Certified Behavior Analyst License (Required)
* NY LBA (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: General Laborer
description:
**JOB SUMMARY**

The Excavation Laborer is responsible for carrying and loading excavation materials for excavators working on projects. Additionally, the Excavation Laborer assists with various labor-related tasks including, but not limited to, excavation, hand-digging with a shovel and project clean up.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Checks daily assignments and coordinates with crew Supervisor
* Assists with excavation needs including the digging of holes and trenches
* Cleans up job sites
* Assists with the loading and unloading of equipment and materials
* Assist with lifting heavy materials such as large bags of concrete

**ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES**

* With proper previous training and/or experience, operates various excavation equipment including mini-excavators, backhoes, drilling/boring machines, jackhammers, and concrete saws
* With valid driver’s license and good driving record, may drive various company vehicles on occasion
* Performs other duties, as needed and when assigned

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Valid driver’s license with good driving record; must provide own transportation to shop or work site each day
* Must be able to lift and carry up to 80 lbs., push and pull up to 80 lbs., and stand or walk for up to eight (8) hours each day
* Must be able to dig/excavate for up to six (6) hours in a day

title: Pharmacy Technician
description:
Regulatory, Privacy and Other

Company Description

PersonalRX, a rapidly growing mail order pharmacy is looking to hire **a pharmacy technician to operate our state-of-the-art automated dispensing equipment .**

We offer a very competitive salary, annual bonuses and part ownership (company stock) in our company for high performers as well as promotional opportunities over time

You do not have to stand and wait on customers all day long and your job responsibilities are varied depending on your experience. Our customers love us because of unique “patient concierge” business model. Check us out at either www.personalrx.com or view our YouTube testimonials (go to YouTube and search on PersonalRX).

We recently raised significant capital and looking to grow in our business by investing in our pharmacy systems and hiring well qualified technicians

Be part of this exciting opportunity and apply now. Someone from our executive team will call you back very quickly.

**Requirements:**

* **NY State license - Preferred**
* **perience operating automated dispensing equipment - preferred**

Job Description

* validate orders prior to running equipment
* run equipment to produce patient dose packs
* replenish medications in the machines
* complete daily maintenance as needed
* complete daily ordering of medications
* work with pharmacists to expedite/prioritize selected orders
* actively participate in pharmacy team meetings
* dispense non automated medication as needed

Other

* Remains active and in good standing with all licensing requirements of the governing states board of pharmacy
* Ensures that all HIPAA regulations regarding patient privacy are followed
* Participate in the company policy for recycling
* Set and complete tasks related to follow-ups in Rx2 to ensure the above work is completed in a timely manner
* Review existing SOPs and Policy and Procedures and enhance/update as needed
* Identify issues/topics that require a new policy or procedure - and share with management

All functions or duties of the registered pharmacy technicians shall be performed under the direct supervision of the pharmacists on duty. The pharmacists on duty will be working in close proximity with the registered pharmacy technicians to ensure adequate control or supervision and shall verify and document registered pharmacy technician work.

**Note: All staff may be cross trained in another related pharmacy jobs.**

Compensation

- Base salary $20-23/hour

- Bonus

- Stock options

- Health benefits

- Significant opportunities for advancement to a supervisor or managerial position

title: Outside Customer Service/Sales Associate
description:
**Sales Associate - Fish Window Cleaning (Monmouth & Ocean County Area)**

**Location:** ***Must reside within a 10-mile radius of Freehold, NJ***


Fish Window Cleaning is seeking enthusiastic Summer Sales Associates to join our team in Monmouth and Ocean County. We cater to over 30,000 businesses in the area, providing in-demand window cleaning services. This role involves visiting businesses Monday through Friday to conduct estimates, offering a flexible schedule with no nights or weekends.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct sales activities including cold calling and following up on warm leads.
* Provide exceptional customer service in person and over the phone.
* Write estimates for window cleaning services.

**Ideal Candidate:**

* Friendly, self-motivated, and enjoys an active, varied work environment.
* Comfortable with consultative sales.
* Previous experience in hospitality or customer service preferred but not required.
* Must have a valid driver’s license, reliable transportation, and liability car insurance.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive pay structure: $18-22 per hour equivalent based on estimates written and closed.
* Paid training provided; no prior experience necessary.
* Flexible hours with a typical schedule of Monday to Friday, 9:00am – 5:00pm.
* Mentorship and career advancement opportunities available.

**How to Apply:** Please apply only if you reside within a 10-mile radius of Freehold, NJ. Click the link to apply and join our team today!

**About Fish Window Cleaning:** Fish Window Cleaning is a franchise. All locations are independently owned and operated. By applying, you acknowledge you are applying to an independent company doing business as Fish Window Cleaning.

 **Typical Schedule:** Mon-Fri, 9:00am – 5:00pm


Pay $18-22 per hour equivalent based on how many estimates you write/close


To get a feel for our business as seen through the eyes of our window cleaners, watch:


https://youtu.be/OFUZoEv1URI

 **FISH offers:**


Paid training, no experience necessary


Pay based on estimates written and closed


No nights or weekends


Flexible hours


Mentoring and other career-advancement opportunities

 **Qualifications needed:**


Valid driver’s license


Reliable transportation to be used throughout the day


Liability car insurance


Provide excellent customer service


Self-motivated and able to work alone most of the day

title: Infant/ Toddler Teacher
description:
Teachers at The Learning Experience are ambassadors of happiness, creating opportunities every day that reflect our mission to make a difference in the lives of children, their families and communities.  

  

Our passionate teachers use a growth mindset to develop young minds and inspire a love of learning.  

  

**Role Responsibilities:**  

* Create a welcoming, engaging classroom space for young children to learn, play and grow
* Use a growth mindset to develop young minds and inspire a love of learning
* Implement our proprietary L.E.A.P. Curriculum®, working with Infants, Toddlers, and/or Preschool children in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child.
* Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
* Communicate regularly with parents, sharing their children’s latest adventures and achievements through a variety of avenues, including mobile apps and personal discussions.
* Support your center’s success, partnering with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment and engagement.
* Build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happen seamlessly.

  

**Qualifications:**  

* At least 6 months of professional teaching experience preferred
* High School Diploma/GED required. College ECE coursework highly preferred.
* Demonstrated knowledge of developmentally appropriate practices
* CPR and First Aid Certification preferred.
* Must meet state specific guidelines for the role.

  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to The Learning Experience Corporate.*
company_description: Happy Happens Here! From preschool through kindergarten, we make early education and daycare joyful, engaging and fun so children are happy to learn, play and grow.

title: Early Childhood Instructor
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Bonus based on performance
* Flexible schedule
* Free uniforms
* Training & development

  

**Looking for a flexible job? Join Soccer Shots and be the best part of a child's week!**  

  

Soccer Shots is an engaging children's soccer program with an emphasis on character development. Our caring team positively impacts children's lives on and off the field through best-in-class coaching, curriculum and communication.  

  

No soccer experience needed! Soccer Shots will provide ALL training!  

  

**WHAT YOU GET:**  

  

* $18 - $20 per 30-45 minute session
* Flexible scheduling catered to your location and availability
* Great company culture
* Thorough Training
* Uniform and equipment necessary to run classes

**WHAT YOU NEED:**  

  

* Passion to positively impact children (ages 2-8)
* Reliable transportation and a valid Drivers License or State ID
* High School Diploma
* Eligible to work in the U.S.

**A DAY IN THE LIFE:**  

  

* Safely manage a class of up to 12 children at a PreK school, park, or indoor field in Monmouth County, NJ
* Implement our curriculum which focuses on skill and character development
* Arrive on-time to your locations and provide a positive customer experience to faculty and families
* Maintain equipment and manage your class rosters

**OUR CORE VALUES:**  

  

* We care
* We own it
* We pursue excellence
* We are stronger together
* We are candid
* We grow


  

If you have a passion for positively impacting children, we’d love to talk to you.  

  

Soccer Shots is an international franchise brand with 200 territories in the U.S. and Canada. This position is for your local franchise. Visit soccershots.com to learn more.  

  

If this isn't for you but you know of someone who might be interested in joining our team, feel free to pass our info along - we love referrals!

* Uniform and equipment necessary to run classes

title: Personal Injury Paralegal
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Personal Injury Paralegal to join our legal team. The ideal candidate will assist attorneys in all stages of personal injury cases from initial client intake through trial preparation.

Responsibilities:

- Conduct client interviews to gather case details and relevant information.  
- Perform data entry and maintain case files accurately.  
- Assist in preparing legal documents, including pleadings, motions, and discovery requests.  
- Utilize legal research tools such as Lexis-Nexis and Westlaw to support case preparation.  
- Handle phone calls with clients, opposing counsel, and court personnel professionally.  
- Draft, transcribe, and proofread legal documents and correspondence.  
- Manage document production using document management systems.

Qualifications:  
- Proven experience as a Paralegal specializing in personal injury law.  
- Proficiency in file organization and management.  
- Familiarity with legal research tools like Lexis-Nexis and Westlaw.  
- Strong phone etiquette and communication skills.  
- Ability to write clearly and concisely for legal documents.  
- Excellent transcription skills for documenting legal proceedings accurately.

This position offers the opportunity to work closely with experienced attorneys in a dynamic legal environment. If you meet the qualifications and are looking to advance your career as a Personal Injury Paralegal, we encourage you to apply.

title: Emergency Restoration Technician
description:
**WHAT DOES AN EMERGENCY RESTORATION TECHNICIAN WITH PAUL DAVIS DO?**  

* Serve others within your community in their time of need.
* Make a difference for others that have had a disaster strike their property.
* Work hard and take pride in completing projects (i.e. mitigating flood and fire damage).
* Be empathetic and show a sense of urgency while communicating through modern technology.


  

**WHY JOIN THE TEAM?** Paul Davis is an industry leader in restoration and reconstruction for insurance providers and both commercial and residential properties throughout the U.S. and Canada. Paul Davis Restoration of Metro New York is headquartered in Queens and serves the broader New York City Metropolitan Area. We are growing locally and have career opportunities for individuals who want purpose out of their work. We view every Mitigation Technician as a long-term hire. We hire only dedicated “A Players”, with the goal of developing them to become experts in the field and future leaders in our company. We provide excellent professional training and a great company culture. Our employees are all treated with love, respect, and appreciation. The vast majority of our employees have been with us for over five years.  

  

Emergency Restoration Technicians will be responsible for providing on-site services to our customers, and will work in teams alongside Senior Technicians, Supervisors, and Management. Emergency Restoration Technicians will be in frontline contact with customers during projects and must represent the company in a positive manner that builds customers’ confidence and trust in our work. Primary tasks include: (1) evaluating and recording damages to a building caused by water, fire, mold, storm, etc.; (2) cleaning and restoring damaged structures, using our professional and specialized equipment and techniques; (3) directly communicating with customers and coordinating with the Paul Davis team to provide extraordinary customer care; and (4) embodying our office’s core values of honesty, integrity, and safety. Mitigation Technicians may also from time to time be asked to support other aspects of our office's operations and growth strategy.  

  

**OUR VALUES:** Deliver what you promise. Respect the individual. Have pride in what you do. Practice continuous improvement.  

  

**OUR VISION:** To provide extraordinary care while serving people in their time of need.  

  

**OUR MISSION:** To provide opportunities for great people to deliver Best in Class results.  

  

  

**WHY THE TEAM NEEDS YOU?** Serving others after a disaster has struck their property is not easy. Everyone within Paul Davis needs to have a world-class work ethic, serious attention to detail and love to help people. You will love being a technician if you take pride in your work and have a genuine interest in learning and helping others.  

  

**Reports To: Mitigation Manager**  

  

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:**  

* High character with uncompromising commitment to honesty and integrity.
* Hardworking attitude, and adaptability to work hours that sometimes can be long or irregular (including on weekends).
* Ability to operate in hazardous environments with care and safety.
* Strong attention to details.
* Genuine desire to help other people.
* Demonstrated record of responsibility, teamwork, and respect for people and properties.
* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Legal authorization to work in the U.S.


  

**PREFERRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCES:**  

* 2-4 years of post-high-school education/training, or an honorable discharge from the U.S. Armed Forces.
* Construction, renovation, or handyman experience and knowledge.
* Technical proficiency with smart phones and tablets, and ability to learn new software and tools.
* Strong communication skills (both oral and written).
* Desire to learn new things and growth within the company.
* Ability to manage other people and projects.
* If limited experience but you meet all Position Requirements, it's okay; we will invest in your training!


  

**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:**  

* Highly competitive hourly wage (varies based on experience level and personal growth), with significant opportunity for overtime pay each week.
* All employees paid weekly!
* Eligible for full benefits after 90 days of employment, including health and disability insurance, earned vacation days and sick days, 401(k) with company matching, monthly cellphone allowance, and additional annual performance-based bonuses.
* Significant cross-training and career growth opportunities!


  

**NOTE:** If you have relevant previous experience and IICRC certifications, you may be eligible to start immediately as a Senior Mitigation Technician (and earn even higher pay).  

  

Please apply if you think you have what it takes to be a team-player and deliver world-class service when others need it the most. We are looking forward to discussing this opportunity with you.  

  

**We love to support and hire Veterans, and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer!**

title: '25 Summer Analyst (Undergrad) – Real Estate Investments
description:
**SUMMARY**



The Investments internship offers a comprehensive immersion into our pivotal responsibilities, encompassing underwriting, asset management, management services, and development. This unique opportunity empowers interns to synergize their adept analytical prowess with effective communication across our platform of services. Our ability to create, strengthen and manage external and internal relationships is the cornerstone of our success. It's our relationship-based strategy that distinguishes us as trailblazers and leaders in our industry.


**WHY WELLTOWER FOR THE SUMMER**



Welltower offers accomplished students the opportunity to partake in a variety of immersive summer internship programs. Each program is meticulously crafted to center around a foundational skill set and essential business processes. This strategic design enables participants to concentrate on their foremost passion and optimize their inherent talents. Spanning over the course of ten enriching weeks, our programs grant students the privilege to engage directly with our esteemed senior management team, take charge of impactful projects, and undergo a transformative journey of personal and professional expansion. All of this transpires within a culture that lauds ambition and tenacity, fostering an environment where aspirations thrive.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**



The Investments team is responsible for:


* Analyzing investment opportunities from initial valuation through closing
* The creation and management of our seniors housing and medical facilities relationships
* Working with our partners to ensure strong financial performance and operations of our joint assets
* Underwriting acquisition and development opportunities
* Operator/client credit analysis; business plan review and analysis
* Analyzing operator performance
* Conducting site visits and market assessments
* Conducting variance analyses; performing liquidity analyses
* Evaluating management teams and properties
* Evaluating property risk
* Analyzing operator performance
* Building financial models
* Creating budgets and forecasts
* Monitoring leasing activity
* Updating ARGUS models
* Understanding market supply and demand fundamentals
* Managing relationships with our operators and partners


**OTHER DUTIES**



Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of this employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.


**TRAVEL**



Some out-of-area and overnight travel may be expected.


**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**



Education: Enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program in Finance, Real Estate, Economics, or related field.



Experience: Previous internship and/or work experience preferred.


*Applicants must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen.*


**COMPENSATION** - the salary range for this role in NYC is $40/hour


**ABOUT WELLTOWER**

Welltower, an S&P 500 company headquartered in Toledo, Ohio, is driving the transformation of health care infrastructure. The Company invests with leading seniors housing operators, post-acute providers and health systems to fund the real estate and infrastructure needed to scale innovative care delivery models and improve people's wellness and overall health care experience. Welltower, a real estate investment trust ("REIT"), owns interests in properties concentrated in major, high-growth markets in the United States, Canada and the United Kingdom, consisting of seniors housing, post-acute communities and outpatient medical properties. More information is available at www.welltower.com


*Welltower is committed to leveraging the talent of a diverse workforce to create great opportunities for our business and our people. EOE/AA. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Vet*


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Director of Child Care Center
description:
This position reports to the Franchisee and is responsible for consistently delivering an exceptional parent/child experience in order to drive education, operations, and marketing for improved profitability. This position assumes the responsibility of and oversees all operations and education functions of the Academy.

***ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and DUTIES***

* Accurately assesses the strengths and developmental opportunities of all staff. Trains, develops and inspires top talent, using performance management tools/processes. Trains staff to plan and implement creative, developmentally appropriate programs for all children. Recommends merit raises for staff when applicable.
* Promotes teamwork by creating a positive and rewarding atmosphere where people want to come to work each day. Inspires others to excel; involves the team in decision making and consistently recognizes individual and team performance while maintaining a high retention rate for top talent.
* Analyzes key business metrics and results to identify performance strengths and opportunities. Recommends impactful solutions that drive results.
* Under the franchisee’s direction, familiarizes self with Academy budgets to ensure that all resources are managed effectively and within budgetary constraints.
* Develops and maintains strong working relationships with all State licensing authorities, approved vendors and community contacts. Meets with licensing specialists during inspections and reports to the franchisee on a timely basis.
* Oversees the physical condition of the building and contents; seeks approval from the franchisee and requests repair work as needed. Obtains estimates and coordinates repairs with vendors. Monitors janitorial work performed and reports any issues to the franchisee.
* Communicates clear priorities and relevant information in a timely manner throughout the Academy. Establishes clearly specified goals and action plans, assigning accountability and follows-up. Creates a disciplined culture that is focused on flawless execution.
* Creates an exceptional parent/child experience using operational tools, excellent communication skills and personal leadership. Anticipates their needs and considers the impact of all decisions and actions. Ensures management is available to greet parents during peak hours (7:00 AM and 6:00 PM).
* Responds and follows up on all enrollment inquiries. Gives prospective customers tours of the facility and detailed information about Kiddie Academy’s philosophy, mission, core values, programs, and procedures. Responsible for keeping disenrolled customers to a minimum; determines reasons for dis-enrollments and addresses problem areas which contribute to student turnover.
* Represents and reinforces the brand in a positive manner through crisp visual presentation and quality of staff. Creation of necessary communication for the team members or others that will help ensure successful operation of the business.
* Completes State requirements for approved continued education training of required clock hours during the licensing year. Ensures that the Academy complies with all

Federal, State, Local and Kiddie Academy requirements and laws.

* Supports and leads new Kiddie Academy initiatives. Facilitates the learning and adaptation of all new programs and business imperatives, while upholding the values and integrity of Kiddie Academy.
* Ensures that the Kiddie Academy proprietary Life Essentials® curriculum is presented as intended; ensuring that teachers can speak to the curriculum and what children are learning.
* Plans Academy activities and actively participates in team meetings, training sessions, open houses, family/community activities, and planning sessions.
* Performs regular observations of classrooms to provide feedback and direction that ensures the Kiddie Academy curriculum is being utilized as expected and learning is accomplished.
* Ensures that quality control programs are sound and meet all State and Kiddie Academy requirements.
* All other duties as assigned.

***JOB QUALIFICATIONS***

* Bachelor’s degree in early childhood education or a related education field
* A minimum of two years’ experience as a center director or assistant director
* Knowledge and experience working with early childhood National and State accrediting agencies
* Knowledge of the early childhood field and developmentally appropriate practices; thorough understanding of child development in early childhood education setting
* Previous experience in and/or knowledge of training, coaching or mentoring mechanisms
* The ability to work independently and as a team member
* Exemplary commitment to customer service
* Must be an effective outward communicator and listener

title: Homeless Prevention housing Specialist
description:
**Essential Job Functions**

· Ensure compliance to regulations for all referrals;

· Participate in onboarding appointments for accepted participants.

· Manage assigned case load of accepted participants;

· Facilitate Case Management meetings at least monthly;

· Provide assistance with obtaining/maintaining any Federal, State, and local benefits and provision of SOAR benefits applications;

· Educate participants on their housing rights;

· Provide life skills training as needed in order to maintain permanent housing including money management and home maintenance;

· Transport residents to view apartments; advocate on resident’s behalf with prospective landlords; must use own personal vehicle when agency vehicle is unavailable;

· Provide or refer to support services designed to stabilize households in permanent, habitable housing;

· Facilitate program graduations.

· Coordinate all aspects of utility and rental arrears payments, rental assistance payments, and other eligible financial assistance.

· Complete 3-month income eligibility reviews for assigned case load.

· Research permanent housing opportunities and maintain housing resource database.

· Coordinate all aspects of participants movement to alternative housing;

· Complete habitability inspections;

· Coordinate lease signings;

· Execute Security Deposits and Repayment Agreements.

· Manage outstanding Security Deposit repayments including monthly invoicing and incoming payments.

· Provide aftercare services to graduates consisting of contact with participants at least monthly for six months following graduation from the program.

· Required to be ambulatory and present and able to perform all job functions without limitations, up to and including life preservation activities.

· Responsible to comply with all Agency Policies including Agency Code of Conduct and Confidentiality Policies, Medicaid Compliance Program and Protocols and Justice Center Code of Conduct.

· Maintain attendance and punctuality. Notify supervisor when late or absent. Provide adequate notice when scheduling time off.

**Job Duties include but are not limited to:**

· Orient, train and supervise assigned staff including preparation of staff evaluations and interviewing prospective candidates for staff positions.

· Attend and participate in staff meetings, training sessions and other relevant meetings as scheduled.

· Develop and maintain relationships with local realtors and landlords.

· Participate in HMIS reporting and SOAR certification

· Report to Support Services Supervisor.

Pay: $27.30 per hour

title: Independent Agent
description:
**GFI** is an independent agency dedicated to empowering American families to achieve financial success. Our mission is to provide comprehensive financial literacy and life insurance products tailored to meet the unique needs of each family, helping them secure a brighter financial future.

At **GFI**, we are committed to making the journey to financial well-being simple and understandable. We pride ourselves on fostering a peaceful, family-oriented environment grounded in strong morals, values, and principles. We celebrate diversity within our team, comprising:

* 42.15% Hispanic/Latino
* 32.77% Black/African American
* 13.83% White/Caucasian
* 1.25% Other

**Role Description**  
**GFI** is seeking a full-time or part-time Financial Sales Specialist based in New York, with the flexibility to work remotely. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining and growing existing accounts, identifying new business opportunities, managing client relationships, and assisting with onboarding new clients and agents.  
**Qualifications**

* Minimum 2+ years of experience in customer service and/or sales preferred but not required
* Proven success in achieving sales targets and meeting deadlines with urgency
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain client relationships
* Highly motivated and coachable
* Ability to work independently and in a team environment
* Strong leadership skills
* Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work under pressure
* Familiarity with the insurance and/or financial services industry is a plus but not required

**Industry Legal Requirements**

* U.S. Resident
* State Licensing will be required

**Training:** We offer weekly on-site full industry system and product training, daily hands-on field training sessions, and licensing training as part of our elite Broker Training Program.  
**Compensation:** Agents, whether part-time or full-time, have access to our industry-leading compensation and incentives plus bonus program. Direct Deposit payments are made twice per week. Residual payouts and override commissions come directly from our carrier partners.

**Mentorship:** Our state-of-the-art mentorship program focuses on the personal and professional success of every associate. You will develop lifelong friendships and receive mentorship from experienced professionals dedicated to helping you achieve your goals.

title: School Custodian
description:
**Notice of Vacancy**

**POSITION:** **Custodial Assignment (School Custodian)**  
**Weston Middle School**

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Knowledge about building cleaning, minor maintenance and building security
* Prior experience preferred
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment
* Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the Board may find appropriate

**Reports to:** Director of Facilities, School Principal, or Designee

**Job Goal:** To provide students with a safe, attractive, comfortable, clean, and efficient place in which to learn and develop.

**Performance Responsibilities:**

* Keeps building and premises, including sidewalks, driveways, and play areas neat and clean at all times
* Shovels, snow blows, and sands walks, driveways, parking areas, and steps as appropriate
* Check daily to ensure that all exit doors are open and all are working properly during the hours of building occupancy
* Vacuums, dust furniture, and empties wastebaskets daily
* Cleans corridors during the day when their condition requires it
* Wet mops kitchen floors after lunch
* Replaces light bulbs, as needed
* Prepares areas and sets up equipment for meetings, assemblies, and rehearsals
* Maintains the lost and found
* Unloads delivery trucks and moves the packages to their designated areas
* Keeps the grounds free from rubbish
* Contacts maintenance and grounds workers when their services are required
* Makes such minor building repairs as he/she is capable of
* Reports major damage or repairs needed promptly to their supervisor
* Remains on the school premises during school hours, and during non-school hours when the use of the building has been authorized and his/her attendance is required
* Assumes responsibility for the opening of the building each school day and determining, before leaving, that all doors and windows are secured, and all lights, except those left on for safety reasons, are turned off.
* Keeps an inventory of supplies, equipment, fuel on hand, and requisitions of such needed replacements from the principal far enough in advance so that they may be delivered in such time as will not hinder the custodian in their duties
* Complies with local laws and procedures for the storage and disposal of trash, rubbish, waste, and recycled materials
* Maintains an appropriate supply of paper and soap products in all classrooms, offices, kitchens, and lavatories
* Sets-up and clean cafeterias on a daily basis
* Maintains constant contact with the main office via walkie-talkie
* Moves furniture, equipment, and supplies within buildings as required for various activities as directed
* Completes tasks assigned by the administration and/or their designee
* Performs such other tasks and assumes such other responsibilities of a Custodian as assigned

Compensation and benefits as established by the contract between the Weston Board of Education and Local 1303-110 of Council #4, AFSCME, AFL-CIO

Performance of this position will be evaluated in accordance with Board’s policy and practice.

title: Sales Personal Training Manager
description:
A Sales Personal Training Manager (SPTM) is a leader among our sales . As a central part of our team, the SPTM at Jersey Strong is responsible for promoting and selling our members into our transformation packages .  

  

This position is ideal for individuals who possess a passion for sales and prospecting, as well as an enthusiasm for helping people get started on their fitness journey. The SPTMis a dynamic fitness professional who is comfortable with both selling and prospecting.  

  

To be exceptional, a strong understanding of fitness and sales is a must, as is a keen understanding of prospecting methods and an outgoing personality.  

  

At Jersey Strong, we are RESULTS FOCUSED, EMPATHETIC, and ENTHUSIASTIC. We focus on specific and measurable results and hustle to meet our goals. We are sensitive to the challenges of each person's unique journey and enthusiastic about the positive role fitness plays in people's lives.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Conduct introductory assessments
* Execute an effective prospecting strategy using approved company lead generation techniques
* Attain company targets, including revenue and client retention
* Follow up on leads and referrals

Maintain regular communications with potential and existing customers  
* 

**Requirements:**  

* Must be an advocate of fitness and exercise
* Full-time availability (40 hours per week)
* Must be able to follow our sales system
* Holding a current N.C.C.A. or N.B.F.E accredited Personal Training certification is a plus but not required
* Must be a goal achiever who understands how to develop, set and achieve personal goals
* Must be a strong verbal communicator

Must love helping people change their lives through fitness  
* 

**Personal Profile:**  

* Extremely neat, organized, detailed, and thorough
* Enjoys multitasking, adapting to changing situations, and works well with monthly performance goals
* Honest, friendly, fun, disciplined, and enjoys regular exercise
* Has an interest in personal education and development
* Takes feedback well and is coachable
* Works hard and does whatever it takes to get a job done right

Takes ownership of responsibilities  
* 

**Benefits:**  

* Option to participate in company 401k after a year of employment
* 1 week vacation after 1 year, 2 weeks after 2 years, 3 weeks after 5 years

Complimentary membership for an immediate family member  
* 

**Compensation:**  

* Annual earnings are based on performance and can range from $50,000 to $60,000

Salary, commission, and bonus  
* 

The Sales Personal Training Manager position is ideal for dynamic fitness professionals who are passionate about fitness and helping people get started on their fitness journey. If you are looking for a real career in the fitness industry, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

title: Traffic Control Flagger
description:
**Company Description** **Unlock Your Career Potential in Traffic Safety with AWP Safety – America’s Leading Traffic Management Company!**

 **Overview:** AWP Safety is on the lookout for motivated individuals to embark on a rewarding career as a Traffic Control Flagger. This entry-level position is perfect for those who thrive in diverse environments and are seeking a dynamic career path without the requirement of a college degree.

 **Are You:**

* Passionate about working outdoors and independently?
* A reliable and hardworking individual with a strong sense of responsibility?
* Keen on maintaining safety and have excellent observational skills?
* Looking for a job that offers a new scene and challenges every day?
* Interested in a career opportunity that values your growth and development without the need for college education?

**Join AWP Safety** and be part of a fast-paced, safety-first culture that prioritizes your growth and development.

 **Job Description** **Role Description:** As a Traffic Control Flagger, you will play a crucial role in:

* Establishing and maintaining safe work zones using the proper equipment.
* Collaborating with team members to ensure the safety of all.
* Managing traffic flow effectively with stop/slow paddles.
* Delivering exceptional service and protection to our clients.
* Benefiting from continuous training and support to advance from an entry-level position to long-term career opportunities.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Valid driver’s license required.
* Ability to stand for 8-12 hours a day and lift 50-60 lbs.
* Willingness to work in various weather conditions and traffic settings.
* Experience driving.
* Must pass pre-employment screenings, including a drug test.

  

**Additional Information** **What We Offer:**

* **Competitive Pay:** $20.25-$21.00/Hourly pay based on experience, guaranteed pay increase within the first year.
* **Rapid Advancement:** Potential opportunities to progress to Senior Protector in just 4 months, with further growth potential to Lead Protector, Field Supervisor, or Manager roles.
* **Comprehensive Training:** Paid, on-the-job training including ATSSA certification and defensive driving, with ongoing professional development.
* **Benefits:** Paid Time Off (PTO), Daily Pay option, and overtime opportunities.
* **Recognition and Rewards:** Competitive referral incentives and recognition for your dedication and hard work.

**Seize the Opportunity to Make a Difference Every Day!**


Apply now to join AWP Safety and embark on a career path that offers unparalleled growth opportunities, comprehensive benefits, and the chance to be a part of America’s leading traffic safety company. Your journey towards a rewarding career in traffic management starts here!


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


AWP considers any position that requires the individual to drive an AWP vehicle and/or be present at an AWP worksite for any reason a safety sensitive position.


*AWP Safety is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Women, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.*

title: Product Marketing Associate Manager
description:
The Product Marketing & Subscriber Strategy team builds DTC strategies and testing roadmaps that drive growth, engagement and business results across subscription types. With a focus on optimizing the fan experience across touchpoints, from Marketing Landing Pages through upselling and cancellation flows, building loyal fans who understand the value proposition and stay subscribers. We understand the DTC business and effectively communicate and steer priorities through strategic and targeted marketing efforts.

**Position Summary:**

As an Associate Manager of Product Marketing at ESPN, this employee is responsible for executing marketing strategies to drive the adoption and usage of ESPN's direct-to-consumer products. This includes collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with product goals, conducting market research to identify opportunities, and crafting compelling messaging to engage target audiences. The employee will also analyze performance metrics to optimize campaigns and contribute to the overall growth and success of ESPN's product offerings. This position will report into the Sr. Director Product Marketing. The position is based in New York, New York.

**Responsibilities:**

* Support the team in developing actionable insights from data, analytics and research to drive programs that maximize engagement of ESPN+ subscribers.
* Work closely with teams focused on engagement and retention, such as Data Analytics and CRM to implement plans and measure effectiveness of each component to ensure refinement and performance evaluation.
* Collaborate cross functionally to ensure projects and campaigns meet deadlines.
* In partnership with product management, understand product features and benefits, ensuring that marketing efforts and education align with goals and enhance the customer experience.
* Analyze subscriber and fan data to identify key segments and tailor marketing campaigns to specific audiences to maximize engagement and retention.
* Monitor and analyze the performance of campaigns using key metrics and KPIs, provide actionable insights and recommendations for optimization.
* Develop presentations and reporting using PowerPoint, Google Slides, and analytics dashboards to highlight product marketing performance and impact.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum 2 years’ experience in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Analytics, or a related field.
* Proven track record of developing and executing successful marketing strategies and campaigns.
* Strong understanding of digital marketing, including social media, content marketing, SEO and more
* Proficiency in marketing analytics and the ability to interpret data to drive decision-making.
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
* Strong creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Proficient in using analytical and marketing automation tools
* Knowledge of graphic design tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite) is a plus.
* Interpersonal Skills:
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external partners.
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Passion for sports and familiarity with ESPN's brand and audience.

**Required Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Marketing, Business, or a related field


#ESPNMEDIA

  

The hiring range for this position in New York, NY is $ $80,770 to $108,350 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Family Shelter Case Manager
description:
**Essential Job Functions**

· Maintain daily contact with residents; conduct and document census checks daily. Facilitate admissions, transfers and discharges; assist residents to obtain permanent housing.

· Ensure children attend school/day care as scheduled and adults participate in structured activities/programs.

· Responsible for reporting, maintaining, reviewing, and regularly updating ongoing records according to Documentation Guidelines and in compliance with DSS and Agency Policies and Procedures.

· Required to be ambulatory and present and able to perform all job functions without limitations, up to and including life preservation activities.

· Provide for the health and safety of the residents and maintain the physical environment.

· Responsible for behavioral interventions/crisis management involving immediate attention in order to ensure the safety of residents and staff and provide feedback to residents concerning acceptable and/or unacceptable behavior. Complete and submit DSS/CPS Reports to Supervisory Staff as needed.

· Responsible to comply with all Agency Policies including Code of Conduct and Confidentiality Policies.

· Maintain attendance and punctuality. Notify supervisor when late or absent. Provide adequate notice when scheduling time off.

**Job Duties include but are not limited to:**

· Assist residents to establish linkages with mental health/health clinics, vocational, educational, financial, substance abuse prevention, special services, childcare and transportation resources as needed.

· Provide training, assistance and monitoring in life skills areas as needed, including meal planning, nutrition, personal appearance, basic parenting, meal preparation, unit maintenance, medication ingestion and recreation participation.

· Assist residents with arranging transportation to appointments and other program related activities. Provide transportation as needed; must use own personal vehicle if agency vehicle is unavailable.

· Ensure residents attend scheduled day activities, appointments, interviews, etc. and complete related documentation. Responsible for planning, implementing and supervising recreational activities when needed.

title: Data Center Technician
description:
This is a first shift role as a Data Center Technician/Data Center Engineer. To be part of a team responsible for the continuous operation and performance of Client's Data Centers. The person in this position will be part of a team responsible for all parts stock, parts readiness and the day-to-day support of server, network and storage components in the Data Center. This support includes chassis, module and power supply replacement during incidents, project engagements, RMA returns and maintenance activities. This position will ensure high quality service delivery through responsiveness to network, server and storage problems. This position will also involve some participation in crisis management and to adhere to service levels and network improvement initiatives. A person in this role is expected to respond to high impact issues on a 24x7 basis.

**Specific areas of responsibility:**

* Responsible for the basic racking and installation of physical IT infrastructure equipment in the data center including Network, Telecommunications, Servers and Storage.
* Participate in project implementation conference calls where and when needed.
* Be able to quickly obtain a basic understanding of Cignas network and SAN design, such that server, network and storage installations can be completed successfully and on time
* Installation of racking new hardware in cabinets within the data center
* Participates in deployment/release activities for Data Center implementations and maintenance ensuring all change policies are followed
* Submit change control, manage problem tickets, schedule and coordinate repairs
* Provide on-site support in the Data Center during incidents, RMA, project and maintenance activities.
* Provide tier II support for data and network, server and storage systems infrastructure.
* Assist in voice and data network problem determination efforts.
* Be able to work off of pre-prepared cabling request sheets and checklists for the vendors
* Perform the installation of Ethernet and Fiber Gig-E cabling for various open systems server and networking projects, including routing, labeling and adhering to cabling management standards.
* Coordinating and manage cabling contractors to perform larger cabling activities
* Checkout connectivity of newly installed hardware for acceptance into production.
* Maintain & document appropriate levels of fiber optic and copper jumper cables to maintain timely system installations.
* Provide planning and vendor oversight for server, network and storage change activity.
* Operate in accordance with business needs, priorities and SLAs
* Provide periodic performance reports for review with management providing input on improvements and quality initiatives.
* **Diagnose, Repair and Support:**
* Participate in a 24/7 on-call rotation.
* Diagnose and swap out defective equipment cables as necessary when trouble shooting.
* Troubleshoot infrastructure problems and perform repairs such as sparing fibers within a trunk.
* Be able to provide local hands and feet on the ground support being guided by others remotely diagnosing LAN and SAN related problems and during equipment installations and break fix related activities.
* Be able to perform minimal required configuration of the OS required to hand over for remote support, such as remote hands, login, etc.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Data center: 2 years (Preferred)
* SAN: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person
